png

Class ChunkDirectory

  • java.lang.Object
    • png.ChunkDirectory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseMetadata, Directory<PngChunk>, java.lang.Iterable<PngChunk>

    public class ChunkDirectory
extends java.lang.Object
implements Directory<PngChunk>
    This class provides the functionality to maintain chunk data stored in a Directory, grouped by its category. If the chunks are of the textual type, either ChunkType.tEXt, ChunkType.iTXt or ChunkType.zTXt, they may be used to extract metadata information if available. Otherwise, if the eXIf chunk happens to exist, it will also be extracted to provide the metadata information.
    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • ChunkDirectory

        public ChunkDirectory(ChunkType.Category category)
        Constructs a new directory instance to store a collection of chunks whose category matches with the specified parameter. If any incoming entries do not correspond to this value, they will not be processed.
        Parameters:
        category - the type of ChunkType.Category enumeration

    • Method Detail

      • getDirectoryCategory

        public ChunkType.Category getDirectoryCategory()
        Returns the category that this directory focuses on.
        Returns:
        a value of ChunkType.Category enumeration

      • existsTextualKeyword

        public boolean existsTextualKeyword(TextKeyword keyword)
        Searches through the collection of textual chunks and checks whether a chunk containing the specified keyword has been set. In normal cases, the following chunk types are potentially expected to contain it: either ChunkType.tEXt, ChunkType.iTXt or ChunkType.zTXt.
        Parameters:
        keyword - specifies the TextKeyword enumeration to check
        Returns:
        a boolean value of true to indicate a successful match, otherwise false if no match is found

      • getTextualData

        public java.util.List<TextEntry> getTextualData(TextKeyword keyword)
        Searches through the collection of textual chunks and returns a list of keyword-value pairs containing the specified keyword if present. In normal cases, the following chunk types are potentially expected to contain it: either ChunkType.tEXt, ChunkType.iTXt or ChunkType.zTXt.
        Parameters:
        keyword - specifies the TextKeyword enumeration
        Returns:
        a list of TextEntry objects. It may be empty if no match is found

      • getTextualData

        public java.util.List<TextEntry> getTextualData(java.lang.String keyword)
        Searches through the collection of textual chunks and returns a list of keyword-value pairs matching the specified keyword. In normal cases, the following chunk types are expected to contain it: either ChunkType.tEXt, ChunkType.iTXt or ChunkType.zTXt.
        Parameters:
        keyword - the keyword in string form to find the corresponding data. Ensure the keyword complies with the PNG specification detailed in https://www.w3.org/TR/png/#11keywords.
        Returns:
        a list of TextEntry objects. It may be empty if no match is found

      • hasChunk

        public boolean hasChunk(ChunkType chunk)
        Checks if the list contains a particular chunk. For example, checking if ChunkType.eXIf has been set.
        Parameters:
        chunk - an enumeration value to check the specified chunk
        Returns:
        a boolean value of true if the specified chunk is present
